trans-unit.source: Represents a user annotation in the Microsoft Annotations Framework.
<xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation> represents a single annotation with all associated anchoring and content data.
An annotation consists of the following main elements.
Zero, one, or more <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Anchors%2A> that identify what is being annotated.
Zero, one, or more <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Cargos%2A> that contain the user data for the annotation.
Zero, one, or more <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Authors%2A> that define who created the annotation.
A <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.CreationTime%2A> that specifies the date and time when the annotation was created.
A <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.LastModificationTime%2A> that specifies when the annotation was last updated.
A unique annotation <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Id%2A> (a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_guid](~/includes/tlasharptla-guid-md.md)]).
This constructor supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_wpf](~/includes/tlasharptla-wpf-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Applications should not use the default constructor without parametersâ€“the default constructor does not fully initialize the instance.
To create a new <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation> applications should use one of the parameter-based constructors.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation"></xref> class that has a specified type name and namespace.
The type name of the annotation.
This constructor supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_wpf](~/includes/tlasharptla-wpf-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
This constructor is used by the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_wpf](~/includes/tlasharptla-wpf-md.md)] serialization infrastructure and should not be used directly under ordinary circumstances.
The type name of the annotation.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_guid](~/includes/tlasharptla-guid-md.md)] for the annotation.
The date and time the annotation was first created.
The date and time the annotation was last modified.
Occurs when an anchor is added, removed, or modified in the list of annotation <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Anchors"></xref>.

In addition to when an anchor is added or removed, <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.AnchorChanged> occurs on any modifications to an anchor subpart, such as a change to a <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocatorPart>.
Gets a collection of zero or more <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationResource"></xref> anchor elements that define the data selection(s) being annotated.

Each <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationResource> in the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Anchors%2A> collection identifies a data selection to which the annotation is bound (in other words, "the data selection that is being annotated").

While most annotations refer to a single data selection and contain just one anchor <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationResource>, multiple anchors can occur if a single annotation refers to multiple data selections.
The returned <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Anchors%2A> collection is never null; however, the collection may contain zero elements.
A collection of zero or more <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationResource"></xref> anchor elements.
Gets the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> of the annotation type.
The returned annotation type is the <xref:System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName> name passed as a parameter to the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
<xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.AnnotationType%2A> returns `null` if the annotation was incorrectly constructed by using a default constructor without parameters.

(The default constructor without parameters does not fully initialize the instance and is used only internally in combination with XML serialization.) To create a new annotation, applications should use the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.%23ctor%2A> constructor that takes an <xref:System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName> as a parameter.
The XML qualified name for this kind of annotation.
Occurs when an author is added, removed, or modified in the list of annotation <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Authors"></xref>.
Gets a collection of zero or more author strings that identify who created the <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation"></xref>.
The returned <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Authors%2A> collection is never `null`; however, the collection can contain zero elements if no author is specified.
A collection of zero or more author strings.
Occurs when a cargo is added, removed, or modified in the list of annotation <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Cargos"></xref>.

In addition to when a cargo is added or removed, <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.CargoChanged> occurs on any modification to a cargo subpart, such as a change to an <xref:System.Xml.XmlElement> in the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationResource.Contents%2A> collection of a cargo.
Gets a collection of zero or more <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationResource"></xref> cargo elements that contain data for the annotation.
Each <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationResource> in the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Cargos%2A> collection contains user-defined data for the annotation.
The returned <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Cargos%2A> collection is never null; however, the collection may contain zero elements if there is no user data for the annotation.
A collection of zero or more <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationResource"></xref> cargo elements.
Gets the date and the time that the annotation was created.

<xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.CreationTime%2A> returns <xref:System.DateTime?displayProperty=fullName> if the annotation was incorrectly created by using the default <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation> constructor without parameters.
An <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation> constructor with parameters should be used to correctly instantiate a new annotation.
The date and the time the annotation was created.
Always returns `null`.
See [Annotations Schema](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/annotations-schema.md) for schema details.
Always `null`.
See [Annotations Schema](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/annotations-schema.md) for schema details.
Gets the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_guid](~/includes/tlasharptla-guid-md.md)] of the <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation"></xref>.

<xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Id%2A> returns <xref:System.Guid.Empty> if the annotation was instantiated by using the default <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation> constructor without parameters.

An <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation> constructor with parameters should be used to correctly instantiate a new annotation with a valid [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_guid](~/includes/tla2sharptla-guid-md.md)].
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_guid](~/includes/tla2sharptla-guid-md.md)] of the annotation.
Gets the date and the time that the annotation was last modified.
The date and the time the annotation was last modified.
Deserializes the <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation"></xref> from a specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref>.
The XML reader to use to deserialize the annotation.
reader is `null`.
The serialized XML for the <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation"></xref> is not valid.
Serializes the annotation to a specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref>.
The XML writer to use to serialize the annotation.
writer is `null`.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.AnnotationType"></xref> is not valid.
